contentList.content: As the practitioners of Magecraft from another world, Magi race towards the past– executing what is theoretically possible with science through supernatural means in a bid to reach the “truth.”
The energy that comes about as the refinement of the planet’s Mana or one’s Od by their Magic Circuits. Needed to fuel Magecraft.

As a result of having the Noble Phantasm Avalon inserted into you in your childhood, both your Origin and Element are Sword. Having recently survived the 5th Holy Grail War, you seek to make your dream a reality even in this alternate world.

As a result of your Origin and Element, your precision with the Five Great Elements is limited. You suffer a -2 penalty to <LSTag Tooltip="SpellDifficultyClass">Spell Save DC</LSTag> and spell <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag>.
You use Reinforcement Magecraft to bolster your body, increasing the damage of Unarmed Attacks by [1], hit point maximum by 25%, and max movement per turn by 33%.
Your body has been reinforced. The damage of Unarmed Attacks is increased by [1], hit point maximum is increased by 25%, and <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is increased by 33%.
The damage of Unarmed Attacks is increased by [1], hit point maximum is increased by 25%, and max movement per turn is increased by 33%.
Reproduce the weapon(s) of a chosen creature in sight.

You become <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with the weapon and any actions associated with the weapon can be performed again without having to take a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. However, as a result of being traced, you suffer a [1] <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack roll</LSTag> penalty and upon failure, if you fail an <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, your traced weapon will break and disappear.
The spellcaster traced this creature active weapon.
Has traced a creature's active weapon.
This weapon has been remade with the seven steps of tracing, giving you proficiency with the weapon.

Your body is made out of swords. Upon falling under 30% of your hitpoint maximum, blades will forcibly attempt to stitch up your wounds, automatically healing [1]. However, if a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> is failed, you take [2] damage and start <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">bleeding</LSTag> for 2 turns.
